titleStmt.title: John Goodryche, clerk versus Thomas Apowen, gentleman, and Katherine, his wife, executrix, and late the wife of William Woseley. 1515 - 1518

abstract.p: A bill of complaint by Hugh Elyot of Bristol, merchant, against John Goodrich, William Wosley and John Wyatt, executors of last will and testament of Robert Thorne.

div.p:
To the most reverend ffather yn god my lord Cardynall
Archbysshup of York &and Chaunceler of England

In most Humble Wyse showith &and compleynyth unto youre noble grace youre pore Orator &and dayly Bedman Hugh Elyot of Brystowe merchuant that where do he &and one Robert Thorne
of the same Towne merchuant late deceasyd aswell yn the parties be yende the see as withyn this Realme bought &and sold Ioyntly to gethers dyverse merchaundysez that ys
to sey Wyne oyl Ode orchell madder &and other merchaundysez too there severall uses &and profytes And after the seid merchaundysez so bought &and sold all tymes usyd to make
there accomptes &and rekenyng of suche somes of money expensys &and other charges as by them were payd for the seid merchaundysez And for the conveyens of
the same yn dyverse Shyppys ynto the partyes beyonde the see And for the retorn of the same And the yncrese therof devydyd bytwene them
to there severall profyttes And so contynewyd there bying &and byllyng of merchaundyses to gether by the space of xxti yeres &and more And so yt ys gracyous
Lord that the xijth day of November the ixth yere of the reign of the Kyng that nowe ys the seid Robert Thorne &and youre seid Orator at Brystowe
afore seid Accomptyd to gether for dyverse somes of money by them payd &and expendyd appon such merchuandyses as they had bought to gether
which amountith to the some of CClxij li xv s ix d And by cause there was varyaunces bytwyxt then yn rekynyng of there bokes &and yn the
resceyte of dyverse somes of money with other exensys &and charges doon by them aswell the seid Robert Thorne as youre seid Orator of there
fre wylles submytttyd them self to stond to the award arbytrement &and Iugement of John Rowland John Jay Wyllam Lane &and John
Shypman the which arbytrators herd there rekynyng And accomptes for the same And for asmoche as yt apperyth unto them that dyverse
resceytes &and paymentes expensys with other charges was doon by them yn the parties beyonde the see And to the masters &and maryners of dyverse
vesselles &and Shyppys wherof at that tyme they cowde have no dewe proffe proof no knowlege they deferryd there arbytrement &and decre to be made
untyll a longer day by fore which day the seid Robert Thorne made Master John Goodrych parson of Crystchurch yn Brystowe a fore seid
Wyllyam Wosley &and John Wyet of the same towne Merchuantes hys executors &and dyed And left unto hys seid executors goodes plate
&and merchuandyses to the valewe of CC markes &and more And often tymes syns the deth of the seid Robert Thorne youre seid pore Oratoure
hath many tymes requyryd the seid Master John Goodryche Wyllyam Wosley &and John Wyet hys executors to here the seid Accomptes wherby he wyrth
have such parte of the seid goodes as by the lawe he ought to have accordyng to right &and good consciens thewhich to doo they hath utterly refusyd &and yet
doth refuse And for asmoch As by the Course of the Comon Lawe no Action of Accompt lyith Ayenst Executors he ys without remedy to hys
uttermust undoyng for ever onlesse then the favoure of youre good grace may be unto hym gracyously showyd yn this behalf to grant awrytte of sub
pena Ayenst the seid Executors commaundyng them &and every of them to appere by fore youre good grace yn the kynges Court of the Chauncery
there to Aunswere unto the premysses And to such other maters as youre seid Orator shall then &and there obiecte &and allegge ayenste them and
thus at the reverens of god &and yn the wey of Charyte
